findings.title: Potential front-run attack in the function storeInfo()
findings.description: Anyone can call this function to update the infoSender[infoHash] to be the msg.sender. So the attacker can call this function via front-run to update the info to be the address of attack. And then call the function deleteInfo() to delete the related information in the eip1271Info and infoSender.

findings.title: Potential fail to verify in the function verifyEIP1271Signature()
findings.description: The logic in the if condition may cause normal 1271 signatures to satisfy it, leading to a failed verification. The info in the standardized EIP1271 signature is not suitable for the client's designed logic.

findings.title: Inaccurate signature length check
findings.description: The function `verifyEIP1271Signature()` does not check the signature length is valid before getting a signature slice. Getting slice beyond the length of the signature will be reverted.

findings.title: Lack of return value for the function storeInfo
findings.description: The `storeInfo` function stores info for the `infoHash` into the mapping `eip1271Info`. However, there is no result returned from the `storeInfo` function to the caller. The function may fail to store info if there is a conflict for the hash of different `info`.

findings.title: Gas Optimization in VWManager.sol
findings.description: Use calldata instead of memory for function parameters to save gas.
